Here you may edit forum access on a user-by-user basis.

Selecting "Yes" will allow the user access to the forum. Selecting "No" will deny the user access to the forum. Any changes made to one user's account will override the default permission settings in their usergroup.

Selecting "Default" will revert the user to the default permissions settings for their usergroup.

We have completed moving attachments to the database. Presently, the attachments still remain in the filesystem. If you are sure that the process completed without incident, go ahead and select yes below to remove the attachments from the filesystem. This step can not be reversed and may take a few minutes depending on the number of attachments. Please be patient.

We will only be able to remove attachments and attachment directories that we have write permission to. Normally this should be every attachment but sometimes the permissions are not correct and the removal will fail. You will need to manually remove the attachments from the filesystem in this event.

Attachment Icons Folder This folder contains the various icons used to represent different attachment file types such as txt, jpg, zip etc.
Here you can specify the fonts and sizes available in the pull down menus for the vBCode toolbar. Separate each entry with a new-line.
'Body' is used to control the color of the outer page border, and to set the basic parameters for all text and links on all pages.
'Buttons' is used to style form buttons such as submit and reset, along with any other <input type="button" ... /> elements.

Button Images Folder This is the folder containing all the button images for this style.
The location of this folder can be overridden by a language setting.
'Category Strips' also has a double purpose. It is used to indicate a 'Category' (no-posting) forum, and it is also used as the style for the main title bar of most tables.
Click the 'Expand/Collapse' button, or double-click the group name to expand or collapse the {1} group of templates.

Code Block Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value controls the width of [code], [php] and [html] bbcode blocks. You may set this value to 'auto', but if you do, Internet Explorer will stretch the width of the block rather than inserting a scrollbar.)</dfn>

Form Element Spacer Size (pixels) <dfn>(This is the size of the spacer used to separate blocks of form elements)</dfn>
Form Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value specifies the width in pixels of most forms in the vBulletin interface)</dfn>
User Control Panel Form Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value allows you to specify a smaller form width, to compensate for the presence of the navigation bar in the user control panel pages)</dfn>
Get customizations made in this style and all parent styles
Get customizations made only in this style
'Highligted Font' is used primarily to highlight search words in search results, but is used occasionally elsewhere too.
Ignore Style Version Use style file even if it was created by a different version of vBulletin?
Inner Border Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value specifies the width in pixels of the inner-border of all colored tables)</dfn>
Inner Table Width (pixels or percentage) <dfn>(This is the width given to every table within your vBulletin pages)</dfn>
'Input Fields' is used to style single and multi-line text boxes in forms.

It appears that you may be removing the vBulletin copyright notice from this template. If this is the case, please be aware that this may be a violation of the license agreement. Continue only if you are sure that you will not be violating the license.
Use this setting to set the style of the <legend> text that appears in the border of <frameset> tags in forms.
Main Table Width (pixels or percentage) <dfn>(This is the width of the table that contains all your vBulletin content)</dfn>
All <select> elements will be styled with this control.
Message Area Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value allows you to specify the width in pixels of the text box used for all message posting in vBulletin)</dfn>
User Control Panel Message Area Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value represents the width in pixels of the message area in user control panel pages)</dfn>
Miscellaneous Images Folder <dfn>This folder contains the various images that do not fit into other category.</dfn>
This group of settings controls the style of the navigation bread-crumb in the Navbar.
No replacement variables are defined for this style
Notes for Using Regular Expressions with Find and Replace
Outer Border Width (pixels) <dfn>(This value specifies the width in pixels of the outer-border of all colored tables)</dfn>
Merge Into Style <dfn>(Selecting a style here will cause the imported style to be merged into an existing style, overwriting any conflicting entries. Leave blank to create a new style)</dfn>
'Page Background' is used primarily to set the background and text colors of the inner-page area.
'Panel' is used to create a panel in which most form elements are displayed.
This style is used for the thick border that surrounds the panel used for most forms.
Please be aware that if this replacement variable is inherited by child styles, they too will lose any customizations you have made for this replacement variable.
Please be aware that if this template is inherited by child styles, they too will lose any customizations you have made for this template.

Please be aware that this will also delete all custom templates belonging to this style.

Any child styles will attach themselves to this set's parent style.
Poll Images Folder <dfn>This folder contains the various images used to build the colored bars in poll voting results.</dfn>
This style is applied to the outer body of 'vbmenu' popup menus.
This style is applied to elements which, when clicked, will open a popup menu. For visual consistency, it is occasionally used simply to emphasize an element containing a clickable link.
When a menu option is highlighted due to the mouse moving over it, it will temporarily be assigned this style.
This style is applied to each row inside a 'vbmenu' popup menu.
Ratings Images Folder <dfn>This folder contains the images used to illustrate the rating applied to an item (usually a thread).</dfn>

The regular expression option is for advanced users only! Setting this option to 'yes' will use preg_replace() instead of str_replace() for your find/replace operation. Do not use this option if you are not sure how to use PCRE regular expressions!

Example usage: Find <img (.*)/?> and replace with <img \1 /> would find all <img> tags and make them XHTML compliant by adding the closing slash. The actual command executed from this would be:

preg_replace('#<img (.*)/?>#siU', '<img \1 />', $template);
Replacement Variable is Customized in this Style
Replacement Variable is Inherited From a Parent Style
Replacement Variable is Unchanged From the Default Style
Reputation Images Folder <dfn>This folder contains the small images used to display a user's current reputation.</dfn>

This will cause all templates to revert to their default or inherited status, although templates you have added yourself will not be affected.

Most table cells in vBulletin use either the First or Second alternating color as their background. Set the attributes for elements using 'Second Alternating Color' here.
On occasions where smaller-than-normal text is required, this style will be applied.
Spacer Size (pixels) <dfn>(Spacing between the body border and the main content)</dfn>

Item Status Icon Folder This folder contains all the icons representing the status of forums, threads, posts etc.
For example: announcement_old.gif / announcement_new.gif
It is strongly recommended that you use the 'test' option before actually performing a regex replace.

'Table Border' serves two purposes - primarily it is used to set the background color of all colored tables, which will show through in the color of the lines between cells. Secondly, you may wish to apply a border to the outside of the table itself.
Table Cell Padding (pixels) <dfn>(This value allows you to set the cellpadding for all tables in vBulletin)</dfn>
Some tables have an additional bar at their base to hold extra controls etc. 'Table Footer' is used to style these.
'Table Header' is most often used as the style for a column heading in a table, but is also occasionally used for the main title bar of a small table, such as 'Posting Rules'.

From time to time, the administrators may want to send you email notices.

When posting messages to the forums or other members, there are three interface types available to you. The simplest of these is a simple text box, while the last is a fully-fledged WYSIWYG editor, which allows you to format your text as you want it and see the results immediately.

Depending upon the capabilities of your web browser, you may not be able to use all of these options. If you experience problems when posting messages, try switching to a different interface type.

If you do not want to send or receive private messages, you may disable the private messaging system.

phrasetype.name: SQL Tools
phrasetype.phrase:
All unique indexes checked and corrected as necessary.

Click the Proceed button to return to the main repair page.
Automatic QueryHelpful, predefined queries for mass updating the settings of users and posts. Once a query is executed it can not be reversed.
Backup database to a file on the server
CSV backup of single database table
Database tables to include in backup

If for whatever reason the UNIQUE indexes in your database have been lost (usually this happens after importing an incomplete or corrupt SQL dump) you may find strange behavior, particularly when using the language and template systems.

This system will attempt to correct the problem and rebuild your UNIQUE indexes.

Please ensure that the mysql-schema.php file is present in the install folder on your web server before continuing.
Manual QueryOnly one query can be run at a time. Once a query is executed it can not be reversed
Path and name of file to save backup to:<dfn>Your web server must have access to write to this directory (usually chmod 0777)</dfn>
Database backup via PHP is only recommended for those with small databases as timeouts may occur. Saving to the server or backup via command line is more reliable.
This query may modify data in your database. If this change is done in error, it is possible that you will not be able to recover from this change. Are you sure you wish to continue?
Send Notification Email When a Private Message is Received
Table {1} already has a unique index
This Table Does Not Support Repair / Optimize
This will only optimize the selected tables. Repairing the tables requires MySQL 3.23 or greater.

You are running MySQL version {1} which supports a new table format called MyISAM.

The ISAMformat does not support repair/optimize so you will need to convert tables to MyISAM before they can be repaired/optimized.

The following tables are using the obsolete ISAM format.

phrasetype.name: BB Code Tools
phrasetype.phrase:
Are you sure you want to delete the BB code called '{1}'?
({2}: {3})

{4} This action can not be un-done.

Explanations:

Title: The title of your tag, which will be used to generate the BB code list.

Tag: This is the text for the BB code, which goes inside the square brackets.
eg. you would use 'b' for tags, 'url' (without quotes) for [url] tags.

Replacement: This is the HTML code for the BB code replacement. Make sure that you include '{param}' (without the quotes) to insert the text between the opening and closing BB code tags, and '{option}' for the parameter within the BB code tag. You can only use {option} if 'Use Option' is set to yes.
eg. you would use <b>{param}</b> for tags, <a href="{option}">{param}</a> for [url=xxx] . You will always use '{param}', but you will only use '{option}' when "Use Option?" is "yes."

Example: This is a sample piece of BB code to use as an example for this particular BB code.
eg. you would use [b]Bold[/b] for [b] tags, [url=http://www.localhost.de]vBulletin[/url] for [url] tags

Description: This is a piece of text to describe the BB code tag. This can include HTML tags if you wish.

Use Option: Setting this option to yes will allow you to create a [tag=option][/tag] style tag, rather than just a [tag][/tag] style tag.

Button Image (Optional) If you would like this bbcode to appear as a clickable button on the message editor toolbar, enter the URL of an image 21 x 20 pixels in size that will act as the button to insert this bbcode.
This is how your text appears after BB Code formatting

phrasetype.name: Statistics Tools
phrasetype.phrase: Start date is after the end date

phrasetype.name: Diagnostic Tools
phrasetype.phrase: Check your mail server to ensure it is configured correctly to allow PHP to send mail from it. You should also check your mail server's error log for more diagnostic information.

No errors were returned while attempting to send the email. Check {1} shortly to confirm you've received the email. If you don't receive the email, try sending the test to a different address. If that fails, check your mail server's configuration.

The goal of this test is to determine whether any vBulletin or PHP settings must be changed to allow the sending of email through vB. To begin, simply enter an email address that you have the ability to access and click Send Email.
After copying the file into the specified "Safe Mode Temp Directory", it became readable. Uploads will function, but only when uploading in safe mode is enable.

After copying the file into the specified "Safe Mode Temp Directory," it remained unreadable. PHP's safe_mode setting must be disabled for uploads to function. You will need to contact your host for this to be changed.
File uploads have been turned off via PHP's file_uploads setting. This can only be handled by contacting your host and asking them to enable the file_upload setting.
This function will list each of your vBulletin files that is tagged with a different version than your forum is currently at, which is {1}.
The following errors were outputted by PHP when attempting to send mail:
The mailing function returned an error while trying to send the mail.
No errors occurred while opening the uploaded file for reading.
No suspect files found in this directory

PHP's open_basedir setting has been set to {1}. The uploaded file was stored outside of this directory and is not readable. You will need to contact your host and ask them to specify upload_tmp_dir with a directory inside {1}. Note that PHP must be able to read and write to this directory.
The "Safe Mode Temp Directory" you have specified ({1}) does not appear to be a directory. Please specify the correct directory and attempt this test again.
You have safe mode uploading enabled but have not specified "Safe Mode Temp Directory". Please specify one on the options page and attempt this test again.
The "Safe Mode Temp Directory" you have specified ({1}) is not writeable by PHP. You will most likely need to make this directory world writeable. Correct this and attempt this test again.
While not exactly a test, this function is helpful for tracking down server issues. Simply select the appropriate type of information and submit the form.

The test was indeterminate. There were problems reading the uploaded file, but none of PHP's settings were identified as causing a problem. At this point, you should attempt to attach a file to a post. If that fails, contact your host as no one will know their own server setup better than them.
You should be able to turn off the "Upload In Safe Mode?" option without any adverse effects.
The attached file could not be copied to {1}. PHP's safe_mode setting must be disabled for uploads to function. You will need to contact your host for this to be changed.
The attached file's temporary location ({1}) could not be found. {2}

This test's purpose is to determine if there are any vBulletin/PHP options you need to change for uploads to function correctly. To begin, simply attach a small file using the box below and submit the form. vBulletin will not save the attached file in anyway.

You are receiving this email because your email address was entered as an email test at {1}.
The first step of this email test script has been completed. However, a formatting test is still necessary:
A paragraph break. A single line break.
Another paragraph break. Another single line break. Another single line break.
If the above lines look correct, you are finished. The email features on your server are setup correctly. If this email is run together on one line, there is possibly a configuration error with your mail server. Please ensure it is configured correctly.

Do not run this if you have pruned posts, manually changed post counts, or imported from another forum package and you wish to maintain your users' current counts. Your members' post counts will PROBABLY decrease so only run this if you believe you really need to! Once they decrease you can not bring them back up without restoring your database or manually editing each user. You have been warned!

Merge allows you to join two user accounts into one single account. The source account will be combined into the destination account.

Posts, threads, calendar events, private messages, post count, reputation, buddylist and ignorelist will be combined.

The combined user will still have the same permissions that the destination user had to begin with. Any access masks or moderator ability that the source user had will not be transferred.

This process can not be reversed.

Message:In the message, you may use $userid, $username, $email, $activateid, and $activatelink.

$activateid will be the activation number the user must use to activate his/her account. $activatelink will be the URL that a user needs to visit to be activated. Note: These will only be defined to users in the "Users Awaiting Email Confirmation" group.

Note: you can not send passwords using this form as they are encrypted in the database. Please link to the 'lost password' form instead.

phrasetype.name: Frontend FAQ/Help
phrasetype.phrase: Avatars are small graphical images that you may choose in your profile. They are displayed by your username on all posts that you make. You can select the image that best describes yourself from your profile options.
The [b], [i] and [u] tags allow you to create text that is bold, italic and underlined.
The [code] tag switches to a fixed-width (monospace) font and preseves all spacing.
The [color] tag allows you to change the color of your text.
The [email] tag allows you to link to an email address. You can include an optional parameter to 'name' your link.
The [font] tag allows you to change the font of your text.
The [highlight] tag allows you to emphasize your text.
The [html] tag allows you to perform syntax highlighting for HTML code.
The [img] tag allows you to embed images within your posts. You can also combine this tag with the [url] tag to maked images become links.

Incorrect vB Code Usage:
  • [url] www.localhost.de [/url] - don't put spaces between the bracketed code and the text you are applying the code to.
  • [email]myname@domain.com[email] - the end brackets must include a forward slash ([/email])
The [indent] tag allows you to indent your text.
The [left], [right] and [center] tags allow you to change the alignment of your text.
The [list] tag allows you to create simple, bulleted lists without specifying an option. Within the value portion, each bullet is denoted by the [*] tag.

The [list] tag allows you to create advanced lists by specifying an option. The option should have a value of 1 (for a numbered list) or A (for an alphabetic with capital letters list) or a (for an alphabetic with lowercase letters list) or I (for a numbered with capital Roman numeral list) or i (for a numbered with small Roman numeral list).
There are no pre-defined avatars available.
The [php] tag performs the same function as the [code] tag, but also adds syntax highlighting for PHP code. Although it is designed for PHP, it may correctly highlight some other C-like languages.
The [post] tag allows you to link to posts by specifying the post id. You can include an optional parameter to 'name' your link.
The [quote] tag allows you to attribute text to someone else.
The [size] tag allows you to change the size of your text.

'Smilies' are small graphical images that can be used to convey an emotion or feeling. If you have used email or internet chat, you are likely familiar with the smilie concept. Certain standard strings are automatically converted into smilies. Try twisting your head on one side if you do not 'get' smilies; using a bit of imagination should reveal a face of some description.

If you want to disable smilies in a post that you make, you can select the 'Disable Smilies' option when posting. This is particularly useful if you are posting program code and you do not want ;) converted to a smilie face!
this text is two sizes larger than normal
this text is in the courier font
The [thread] tag allows you to link to threads by specifying the thread id. You can include an optional parameter to 'name' your link.
The [url] tag allows you to link to other websites and files. You can include an optional parameter to 'name' your link.

vB code is a set of tags based on the HTML language that you may already be familiar with. They allow you to add formatting to your messages in the same way as HTML does, but have a simpler syntax and will never break the layout of the pages you are viewing. The ability to use vB Code is set on a forum-by-forum basis by the administrator, so you should check the forum rules when you post a new message.

Below is a list of the vB Codes you can use to format your messages.

phrasetype.name: Register
phrasetype.phrase: Please contact the webmaster with any questions

All users under the age of 13 must seek permission from their parent or guardian in order to gain membership of the {1} forums. While we welcome participation from members under 13, we require that a parent or guardian fax or mail back a signed permission form before we grant membership.

If you would like to start the registration process prior to us receiving a permission form, check the 'I agree' checkbox and press the 'Register' button below. If you would like to cancel the registration, click here to return to the forums index.

A copy of the permission form can be downloaded here.

For more information about the registration process, or the {1} forums in general, please send email to {4}.

Forum Rules

Registration to this forum is free! We do insist that you abide by the rules and policies detailed below. If you agree to the terms, please check the 'I agree' checkbox and press the 'Register' button below. If you would like to cancel the registration, click here to return to the forums index.

Although the administrators and moderators of {2} will attempt to keep all objectionable messages off this forum, it is impossible for us to review all messages. All messages express the views of the author, and neither the owners of {2}, nor Jelsoft Enterprises Ltd. (developers of vBulletin) will be held responsible for the content of any message.

By agreeing to these rules, you warrant that you will not post any messages that are obscene, vulgar, sexually-orientated, hateful, threatening, or otherwise violative of any laws.

The owners of {2} reserve the right to remove, edit, move or close any thread for any reason.

The leaving of user note's for members of this usergroup is not allowed.
The administrator has disabled Who's Online.
You have reached your stored private message quota and can not send any further messages until space has been created.

phrasetype.name: Front-End Redirect Messages
phrasetype.phrase: $userinfo[username] has now been successfully added to your buddy list. You will now be returned to where you were.
$userinfo[username] has now been successfully added to your ignore list. You will now be returned to where you were.
Thanks for adding that event, you will now be returned to the event.
Thanks for deleting that event. You will now be returned to your calendar.
Your event will not appear on the calendar until it is approved by a moderator.
Thanks for updating that event, you will be returned to it.
The post has been successfully deleted. You will now be returned to the thread.
The selected posts have been deleted. You will now be returned to the thread.
The thread has been successfully deleted. You will now be returned to the forum.
User Note has been deleted and you will now be returned to $userinfo[username]'s User Notes.
This post is a duplicate of a post that you have posted in the last five minutes. You will be redirected to that thread.
This thread is a duplicate of a thread that you have posted in the last five minutes. You will be redirected to the thread listings.
The post has been successfully edited. You are now being taken to the post.
The thread has been successfully edited. You are now being taken to the thread.
Your $itemtype folders have been updated. You will now be returned to your $itemtypes.
The password was correctly entered. You are being redirected to where you were.
Your account details and activation code have been sent to that email address. You will now be returned to where you were.
Your username and details about how to reset your password have been sent to you by email. You will now be returned to where you were before.
All forums have been marked as read and the new post indicators will now be off.
This forum has been marked as read and its new post indicator will now be off.
Those threads have been successfully merged. You will now be returned to the result of the merging.
The thread has been successfully moved / copied. You will now be returned to the thread.
You have chosen not to delete this post. You are now being returned to the thread.
You will be returned to $userinfo[username]'s User Notes.
The thread has been successfully $action. You are now being taken to the thread.
The message(s) have been deleted. You are now being redirected to your PM list.
Your private message has been sent. You will now be taken to your PM list. Thanks!
Your message(s) have been moved. You will now be returned to your PM list.
Thank you for voting. You will now be taken back to the poll.
This post was successfully managed. You are now being redirected to it.

Thank you for posting! You will now be taken to your post. If the administrator has selected to moderate all posts in this forum, you will be taken back to the forum and your post will be displayed presently. If you opted to post a poll, you will now be allowed to do so.
Thread moved redirects successfully removed. You are now being redirected back to the thread.
Thank you for registering, $username. You will now be returned to the forum summary page.
Reminder(s) have been deleted. You will now be returned to your current event reminders.
$userinfo[username] has now been successfully removed from your buddy list. You will now be returned to where you were.
$userinfo[username] has now been successfully removed from your ignore list. You will now be returned to where you were.
Thank you for reporting that post. It will be dealt with as appropriate in due course.
Thanks for adding Reputation to this user. May you be lucky enough to receive the same Reputation back in turn.
Your search is in progress and you will be taken to the results in a moment. Thank you for your patience.
We have sent your email to $sendtoname. You will now be returned to the thread.
Your feedback to the webmaster has been sent.
The thread has been successfully split into two. Please wait while you are taken to the new thread.
The thread has been successfully $action. You are now being taken to the thread.
Your thread(s) have been moved. You will now be returned to your subscriptions.
Your email subscription choices have been updated. You will now be returned to your subscriptions.
Your thread(s) have been moved. You will now be returned to your subscriptions.
A notification for this event has been added.
A subscription for this forum has been added.
A subscription for this thread has been added.
Your notification for this event has been removed.
Your subscription for this forum has been removed.
Your subscription for this thread has been removed.
Subscription(s) have been updated. You will now be returned to your current subscriptions.
Sorry! This thread is closed! You will now be returned to the thread.
Your vote on this thread has been added.
Your vote on this thread has been updated.
Your buddy list has been updated.
Your ignore list has been updated.
Thank you for updating your profile, $bbuserinfo[username].
Thank you for updating your profile, $bbuserinfo[username]. Because you changed your email address, you will be sent an email to verify its existence.
Your primary display group is now $usergroup[title]
You are no longer a member of this usergroup.
Your request to join this usergroup has been logged.
Congratulations, you are now a member of the $usergroupname usergroup.
Your note regarding $userinfo[username] has been recorded.

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase:
$user[username],
Your account on $vboptions[bbtitle] has been locked because someone has tried to log into the account with the wrong password more than 5 times. You will be able to attempt to log in again in another 15 minutes.
The person trying to log into your account had the following IP address: $ip
Don't forget that the password is case sensitive. Forgotten your password? Use the link below: $vboptions[bburl]/login.php?do=lostpw
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

Dear $username, Thank you for registering for the $vboptions[bbtitle] forums. Before we can activate your account one last step must be taken to complete your registration. Please note - you must complete this last step to become a registered member. You will only need to visit the link once to activate your account. To complete your registration, please visit the following link: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=act&u=$userid&i=$activateid America Online Users Please Visit Here to be Activated **** Does The Above Link Not Work? **** If the above link does not work, please use your Web browser to go to: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=ver Please to be sure not to add extra spaces. You will need to type in your username and activation number on the page that appears when you click on or copy the above link in your browser. Your Username is: $username Your Activation ID is: $activateid If you are still having problems signing up please contact a member of our support staff at $vboptions[webmasteremail] Thanks very much, $vboptions[bbtitle] team -------------------- To stop receiving this email, please visit this link: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=act&u=$userid&i=$activateid

Dear $username, Since you have recently changed your email, we require that you verify your new email address. You will only need to click on the link once, and your account will be updated. To complete reverification, please visit the following link: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=act&u=$userid&i=$activateid America Online Users Please Visit Here to be Activated **** Does The Above Link Not Work? **** If the above link does not work, please use your Web browser to go to: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=ver Please to be sure not to add extra spaces. You will need to type in your username and activation number on the page that appears when you click on or copy the above link in your browser. Your Username is: $username Your Activation ID is: $activateid If you are still having problems verifying up please contact a member of our support staff at $vboptions[webmasteremail] Thanks very much, $vboptions[bbtitle] team -------------------- To stop receiving this email, please visit this link: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=act&u=$userid&i=$activateid

$bbuserinfo[username] has just tried to attach a file that would exceed the $vboptions[attachtotalspace] byte quota you setup by $overage.
In order to allow users to continue attaching files, we recommend you delete some attachments. You can perform attachment management on the following pages:
$vboptions[bburl]/admincp/attachment.php?do=intro $vboptions[bburl]/admincp/attachment.php?do=stats

Hello $username,
We at $vboptions[bbtitle] would like to wish you a happy birthday today!

The following message was sent to you via the $vboptions[bbtitle] Contact Us form by $name.
--------------------------------
$message
--------------------------------
Referring Page: $url IP Address: $ip User Name: $bbuserinfo[username] User ID: $bbuserinfo[userid]

Hello,
You are subscribed to the forum $forum[title], there have been $newthreads new threads and $updatedthreads updated threads. $vboptions[bburl]/forumdisplay.php?forumid=$forum[forumid]
The following threads are new: $newthreadbits
The following threads have been updated: $updatedthreadbits
Yours, $vboptions[bbtitle] team
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Unsubscription information:
To unsubscribe from this forum, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/subscription.php?do=usub&forumid=$forum[forumid]

Hello,
You are subscribed to the thread "$thread[title]" by $thread[postusername], there have been $thread[newposts] posts to this thread, the last poster was $thread[lastposter]. $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?threadid=$thread[threadid]
These following posts were made to the thread: $postbits
Yours, $vboptions[bbtitle] team
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Unsubscription information:
To unsubscribe from this thread, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/subscription.php?do=usub&threadid=$thread[threadid]

************ $thread[title] $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?threadid=$thread[threadid] In forum: $thread[forumtitle] Started by: $thread[postusername] Last post: $thread[lastreplydate] $thread[lastreplytime]

Hello,
You have requested to reset your password on $vboptions[bbtitle] forums because you have forgotten your password. If you did not request this, please ignore it. It will expire and become useless in 24 hours time.
To reset your password, please visit the following page: $vboptions[bburl]/login.php?a=pwd&u=$user[userid]&i=$user[activationid]
When you visit that page, your password will be reset, and the new password will be emailed to you.
Your username is: $user[username]
To edit your profile, go to this page: $vboptions[bburl]/profile.php?do=editprofile
Yours, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

Dear $username,
Unfortunately your registration at $vboptions[bbtitle] did not meet our membership requirements. Therefore your registration was deleted.
Sorry, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

Dear $username,
We have now activated your account at the $vboptions[bbtitle]. The forums can be found here:
$vboptions[bburl]/$vboptions[forumhome].php
Your login details are as follows: Username: $username Password: as you entered it when you registered
Don't forget that your password is case sensitive.
To edit your profile, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/profile.php?do=editprofile
Thanks, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

Hello,
$bbuserinfo[username] has just posted in the $foruminfo[title] forum of $vboptions[bbtitle] under the title of $threadinfo[title].
This thread is located at $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?threadid=$threadinfo[threadid]
Here is the message that has just been posted: *************** $post[message] ***************

Hello,

This event is located at $vboptions[bburl]/calendar.php?do=getinfo&e=$eventid

There is a new user, $username at $vboptions[bbtitle]
To view their profile, go here:
$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?userid=$userid
Email Address : $email Birthday : $birthday
$customfields

Hello $touser[username],
$bbuserinfo[username] has just replied to a thread you have subscribed to entitled - $threadinfo[title] - in the $foruminfo[title] forum of $vboptions[bbtitle].
This thread is located at: $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?t=$threadinfo[threadid]&goto=newpost
Here is the message that has just been posted: *************** $pagetext ***************
There may be other replies also, but you will not receive any more notifications until you visit the forum again.
Yours, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

To unsubscribe from this thread, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/subscription.php?do=usub&t=$threadinfo[threadid]
To unsubscribe from ALL threads, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/subscription.php?do=viewsubscription&folderid=all

Hello,
Your access to the paid subscription "$subscription_title" is about to expire. To extend this you must visit $vboptions[bburl]/subscriptions.php
If you do not extend your subscription access will be removed.
Yours, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

Dear Parent/Guardian of $username,
$username has just signed up for an account or modified their profile at $vboptions[bbtitle]. This can be found at:
$vboptions[bburl]/$vboptions[forumhome].php
This email has been sent to you because $username has stated that they are younger than 13 years of age and forum is in compliance with the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA).
To find out more about COPPA, please visit this page: http://www.ftc.gov/opa/1999/10/childfinal.htm
Please read the $vboptions[bbtitle] Privacy Statement also: $vboptions[privacyurl]
If $username has just signed up for account, then you must print out the permission form, fill it in and mail or fax it back to the webmaster. Details about how to return the form are on the form itself.
The form can be accessed through this page:
$vboptions[bburl]/profile.php?do=editprofile
From that page, you can also view the profile and make any modification you wish. You will need these login details:
Username: $username Password: $password (Note that the password is case sensitive)
We thank you for helping us in keeping the privacy of children on the internet.
Yours,
$vboptions[bbtitle] team

Hello $touserinfo[username],
$bbuserinfo[username] has just tried to send you a private message. However, your private messages box on $vboptions[bbtitle] has reached the specified quota. In order to receive further private messages, you must delete some messages. Please visit this page to do so: $vboptions[bburl]/private.php
Thanks, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

$touserinfo[username],
You have received a new private message at $vboptions[bbtitle] from $bbuserinfo[username]. Please click here to log in and read it: $vboptions[bburl]/private.php
Thanks, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

$bbuserinfo[username] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this post:
$postinfo[title] $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?postid=$postinfo[postid]#post$postinfo[postid]
This is part of this thread: $threadinfo[title] $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?threadid=$threadinfo[threadid]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reason
This message has been sent to all moderators of this forum, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this post as applicable.

Hello,
As you requested, your password has now been reset. Your new details are as follows:
Username: $userinfo[username] Password: $newpassword

Regards, $vboptions[bbtitle] team

$emailmessage

To email $bbuserinfo[username], you can use this online form: $vboptions[bburl]/sendmessage.php?do=mailmember&userid=$bbuserinfo[userid]
OR, by email: mailto:$bbuserinfo[email]
This is the message:
$message

$username,
Thanks for registering at $vboptions[bbtitle]! We are glad you have chosen to be a part of our community and we hope you enjoy your stay.

phrasetype.name: Email Subject Text
phrasetype.phrase: Action Required to Activate Membership for $vboptions[bbtitle]!
Action Required to Verify Membership for $vboptions[bbtitle]!

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Selecting 'No' will disable Who's Online for everyone.
Display Guest (non-registered user) activity on Who's Online?

Time period in seconds to refresh the Who's Online display.

A value of 0 disables the auto-refresh.

Resolve IP addresses for those who have access to view them?

This can dramatically slow down the Display of Who's Online.

This option does not work with some combinations of web server, so is off by default. However, some IIS setups may need it turned on.

It will send the 200 OK HTTP headers if turned on.
Specify the time-limit (in minutes) within which the thread may have a poll added to it.
Time Limit on Adding a Poll to a Thread
Address of your company. COPPA forms will be posted to this address.

Add the template name at the beginning and end of every template rendered. This is useful for debugging and analyzing the HTML code, but turn it off to save bandwidth when running in a production environment.
Add Template Name in HTML Comments

How many reputation points does an administrator give or take away with each click?

Set to 0 to have administrators follow the same rules as everyone else.
Display the 'Quick Stats' on the main index page of the Admin Control Panel?

Allow users to delete attachments, even if the post edit time limit has been exceeded? If you have attachment quotas enabled then you will need this option enabled to allow users to delete attachments once they reach their quota. The user will still need permission to edit posts in the forum for this to apply.
Allow Deletion of Attachments Beyond Edit Time Limit
Allow users to include vB Code in their signatures? (Such as [b], [i] etc.)
Allow users to include [IMG] codes in their signatures?

This allows users to set their preferred style set on registration or when editing their option. Setting this to 'No' disables that option and will force them to use whatever style has been specified.

Allow users to delete attachments from threads that are closed? If you have attachment quotas enabled then you might need this option enabled to allow users to delete attachments once they reach their quota. The user will still need permission to edit posts in the forum for this to apply. If the above option is set to NO then this option will only apply up to the edit time limit setting.
Allow Deletion of Attachments in Closed Threads
This setting only checks for attachments posted by the user that is making the post.
With this option set to 'no', the [IMG] tag will not be displayed if the path to the image contains dynamic characters such as ? and &. This can prevent malicious use of the [IMG] tag.

This setting allows you to enable and disable all the built-in bbcodes in vBulletin.

Disabling a bbcode will prevent it from working anywhere on the forum, including signatures, private messages, user notes etc.

Allow users to include raw HTML code in their signatures?
(Strongly not recommended.)

On some servers, calls to getimagesize() to check image dimensions may fail for currently unknown reasons. If you are affected by this, you will want to set this option to 'Yes', otherwise you will not be able to upload images (avatars or attachments). However, users may be able to get around your image dimension limits!

If you ban an email address and a user already uses that address, a problem will occur. Using this option, you can specify whether the user will have to enter a new email address in their profile when they next modify their email address, or whether the user can just keep the email address which you have banned.
Allow User to Keep Banned Email Addresses

Normally, vBulletin will stop users signing up for multiple names by checking for a cookie on the user's machine. If one exists, then the user may not sign up for additional names. Note: This does not stop users from logging out and the registering new accounts.

If you wish to allow your users to sign up for multiple names, then select yes for this option, and they will not be blocked from registering additional usernames.
Setting this value to 'Yes' will enable anyone to view your phpinfo() page by adding '&do=phpinfo' to the URL.

If you would like to temporarily (or permanently) prevent anyone new from registering, you can do so. Anyone attempting to register will be told that you are not accepting new registrations at this time.
Allow registered users to have signatures (small text fragments that appear after each message posted by that user).
Allow users to include smilies in their signatures?
Use this setting to enable or completely disable the Threaded and Hybrid thread display modes.
This global switch allows you to completely disable the message formatting toolbar and clickable smilies.
Allow users to use a star (*) in searches to match partial words? (Eg: 'bu*' matches 'bug' and '*bu*' matches 'vBulletin').
The number of posts to display per page in the thread listing.

The number of threads to display per page in the threads listing.
This is done on a per-forum basis.

The Search-Friendly Archive works only under the Apache web server with PHP compiled as a module.

It provides a basic structure that search engines can spider to grab all the content on your site.
This option sets how many attachment input boxes are displayed on the upload form.

Leave this setting alone.

Before RC1, we stored attachments for each user in a sub folder named after that user's userid. This resulted in us having X folders for X users with attachments. Some systems couldn't cope when this number exceeded 32,768 so we altered this method for RC1. Now each digit of the userid is made into a directory, i.e. userid 568 gets her attachments stored in /path/5/6/8. To use the new setting you must move all of your attachments back into the DB and then move them back out to the FS. This is the only way to 'activate' the new option.
Number of files that may be attached to a single post. Set to '0' to have no limit.

Option to update attachment views immediately, or once an hour. If you have a large number of inline graphic attachments, you will probably want to disable immediate updates, since they are quite server intensive.
How many thumbnails do you wish to display per line on user's post, assuming you allow more than one attachment per post?

If your version of PHP supports image functions, you may enable the creation of thumbnails for images. JPG and PNG are normally supported, and you may have support for GIF if you have a newer version of PHP. You will need to go to Import & Maintenance -> Update Counters -> Rebuild Attachment Thumbnails after changing this setting. The sharpen option produces a sharper image at the cost of CPU time which will only be noticeable during a complete thumbnail rebuild, and it requires GD 2+. If you see an image below then thumbnails will probably work for you.

Maximum width and height that the thumbnail can have. The image will be proportionately resized so that the longest side is no larger than this setting. If you change this setting, you will need to go to Import & Maintenance -> Update Counters -> Rebuild Attachment Thumbnails.

Use this option to limit the total combined amount of disk space in bytes that all attachments can occupy.

Set the option to 0 to have no disk space limit.
Limit Space Taken Up By Attachments (Total)
Your Login ID for authorize.net. Please read the manual for instructions on how to change the transaction key.
Allow user to upload their own custom avatar from another website if they have enough posts?
Minimum number of posts that a user required before they can specify a custom avatar for use.

Use this option to enable/disable the overall use of avatars.

Avatars are small images chosen by the user and displayed under usernames in thread display and user info pages.
The maximum height in pixels that an uploaded avatar may be.

The maximum file size (in bytes) that a custom avatar may be.
1 KB = 1024 bytes
1 MB = 1048576 bytes
The maximum width in pixels that an uploaded avatar may be.

Email address ban lists: You may ban any email addresses from registering and posting. Type in the complete email address (user@example.com), or use a partial email address (as in @example.com).

If the email address of a user attempting to register or change their email address matches any of the addresses you specify here will see a no-permission error. For example, if you have banned 'example.com' then a user attempting to use 'someone@example.com' will be rejected.

Put a space between each email address or email address fragment.

IP address ban lists: You may ban any IP addresses from registering and posting. Type in the complete IP number (as in 243.21.31.7), or use a partial IP number (as in 243.21.31).

vBulletin will do matches from the beginning of each IP number that you enter. Thus, If you enter a partial IP of 243.21.31, someone attempting to register who has an IP number of 243.21.31.5 will not be able to register. Similarly, if you have an IP ban on 243.21, someone registering who has an IP of 243.21.3.44 will not be able to register. Thus, be careful when you add IPs to your ban list and be as specific as possible.

As with the email ban list, put a space between each IP number. The IP Ban prevents anyone with matching IP number from registering and posting.

From time to time, you may want to turn your forum off to the public while you perform maintenance, update versions, etc. When you turn your forum off, visitors will receive a message that states that the forum is temporarily unavailable. Administrators will still be able to see the forum.

Use this as a master switch for your forum. You can set options for individual user groups in the User Permissions area.

The text that is presented when the BB is closed.

Note: as an administrator, you will be able to see the forums as usual, even when you have turned them off to the public.
Name of your forum. This appears in the title of every page.

URL of your forum.
Note: do not add a trailing slash. ("/")

If you would like the birthdays displayed on the forum home page to only show birthdays for those users who have been active recently, you may set this value to be a number of days -ie: setting '30' will constrain the display to only show birthdays of users who have been active in the last 30 days.

Set '0' to disable the activity check.
Show birthdays for active users only

If there are certain raw ASCII characters you would like to strip from posts/usernames etc, enter their ASCII numbers here, separated by spaces.

Please note that stripping raw ASCII characters with this setting may break some double-byte languages. If you are unsure, remove the contents of this setting.
Number of days to maintain a cached copy of a post. This makes threads faster to display, but means that each post takes approximately twice the storage space.
Pick the day that you would like the weeks on your calendar to start with. Users can also change this in their profile to match their locale's customs.
Allow VB code to be used in calendar events?
Allow HTML to be used in the calendar events?
Allow smilies to be used in calendar events?
Allow [IMG] code to be used in calendar events?
Format of date shown in profile when user gives their birth-year.
Format For Birthdays with Year Specified

Format of user's birthday shown on profile when the user does not specify their birth-year.
DO NOT put in a code for the year.
Format For Birthdays with Year Unspecified
Show the individual birthdays for each user on the calendar? Set this to NO to just show a link if a particular day has birthdays on it.
Length to cut off titles when displayed on the main calendar. 0 disables cut-off.

This character (or characters) will be used to replace censored words. For example, if you have censored the word 'dog' and you set the censor character here to an asterisk (*) then any occurrences of 'dog' in messages will appear as '***'.

Type all words you want censored in the field below. Do not use commas to separate words, just use spaces. For example, type "dog cat boy", rather than "dog, cat, boy."

If you type "dog", all words containing the string "dog" would be censored (dogma, for instance, would appear as "***ma"). To censor more accurately, you can require that censors occur only for exact words. You can do this by placing a censor word in curly braces, as in {dog}. Signifying "dog" in the curly braces would mean that dogma would appear as dogma, but dog would appear as "***". Thus your censor list may appear as: cat {dog} {barn} barn

Do not use quotation marks and make sure you use curly braces, not parentheses, when specifying exact words.
Selecting 'Yes' for this option will cause the system to check the private message database every time a user loads a page, and will display a visible prompt if a new message has just been saved.
Instant Messaging Support - Check for New Private Messages

Please enter the path of your clear.gif image, relative to your forum directory.
By default, the value of this setting is 'clear.gif', meaning that the image is located in the base directory of your vBulletin installation (in the same folder as forumdisplay.php).

This URL must be relative, NOT beginning with 'http://'.

When a user posts a block of [CODE], [PHP] or [HTML] in one of their messages, the system will place it in a box, which expands to contain their message.

This value controls the number of lines at which the box stops adding height and inserts a scrollbar.
The name of your company. This is required for COPPA compliance.

Link for contacting the site admin. To use the built-in email form, specify sendmessage.php otherwise use something such as 'mailto:webmaster@example.com' or your own custom form. This appears at the bottom of every page.

You may pre-define subjects for users to pick from when using the default Contact Us form listed above. Please place one subject per line. An 'Other' option will be automatically added to the end when the form is viewed.

The domain on which you want the cookie to have effect. If you want this to affect all of example.com rather than just forums.example.com, enter .example.com here (note the 2 dots!!!). You can leave this setting blank.

The path that the cookie is saved to. If you run more than one forum on the same domain, it will be necessary to set this to the individual directories of the forums. Otherwise, just leave it as / .

Please note that your path should always end in a forward-slash; for example '/forums/', '/vbulletin/' etc.
This is the time in seconds that a user must remain inactive before any unread posts are marked read. This setting also controls how long a user will remain on Who's Online after their last activity.

Setting this option to yes will cause search index information to be copied with each post in the thread. This allows the copied version of the thread to be searchable.

However, on larger boards, this may cause significant delays in copying a thread. If this is a problem for you, we recommend disabling this option.
Duplicate Search Index Information on Thread Copy?
Copyright text to insert in the footer of the page.

There are three options for the display of the Forum Manager:
  • Default - Displays all of the forums on one page but may not work on all browsers, especially if you have a large number of forums.
  • Collapsible - Allows collapsing/expansion of certain forums within the forum manager. This may reduce the ease of usability of the forum manager, but will prevent rendering problems with the dropdown menus with certain browsers/operating systems.
  • Single - Display a single dropdown from which you may choose the forum you wish to modify. This is most useful if you have a large number of forums.
Number of columns to display in user editor. Smaller resolutions will probably want to set this to 1.

This setting allows you to specify an alternative style for the Admin / Moderator Control Panels, based on a folder contained within the 'cpstyles' folder. The style you select here will be displayed to all Moderators, and any Administrators who have not expressed their own preference.

Folders in the 'cpstyles' folder must contain at least the following:

- controlpanel.css
- cp_logo.gif
- cp_help.gif

Do you want to exempt your forum Moderators from the censor words? You will want to set this to yes if you censor anything that is part of a moderator's title like 'moderator' as they have custom titles by default and will get censored.

Type all words you want censored in the Usertitle in the field below. Do not use commas to separate words, just use spaces. For example, type "dog cat boy", rather than "dog, cat, boy."

If you type "dog", all words containing the string "dog" would be censored (dogma, for instance, would appear as "***ma"). To censor more accurately, you can require that censors occur only for exact words. You can do this by placing a censor word in curly braces, as in {dog}. Signifying "dog" in the curly braces would mean that dogma would appear as dogma, but dog would appear as "***". Thus your censor list may appear as: cat {dog} {barn} barn

Do not use quotation marks and make sure you use curly braces, not parentheses, when specifying exact words.
Number of days a user must be registered before they can use custom titles.

Do you want a user to have to have the number of posts you specified above AND be registered the number of days you specified above? If you select NO then if a user satisfies EITHER criteria than they can use custom titles. For Ex a User has been registered for 1 year but only has 20 posts. If you specified 100 posts and 1 year then they could use titles if you select NO.
This is the maximum number of characters allowed for a user's custom title.
Number of posts a user must have before they can use custom titles.

Format in which the date is presented on vBulletin pages:

See: http://www.php.net/manual-lookup.php?function=date

Examples:
US Format (e.g., 04-25-98): m-d-y
Expanded US Format (e.g., April 25th, 1998): F jS, Y
European Format (e.g., 25-04-98): d-m-y
Expanded European Format (e.g., 25th April 1998): jS F Y
The newest item in the result set will score this number, with the score decreasing to 0 for the oldest item in the result set.
The user options on the New User creation form in in the Admin Control Panel, as well as the New User registration form will default to the following settings.
Enter the meta description for all pages. This is used by search engines to index your pages more relevantly.

If you would like to prevent vBulletin from sending email to the $technicalemail address you specified in config.php, set this value to 'Yes'.
  1. Error reports about database connection errors will still be sent.
  2. It is not recommended that you set this value to 'Yes' unless you are logging database errors to a file. (see above)
Allow users to send emails to other users. Use the option below to determine how the emails are sent.
Allow Users to Email Other Members

Displays those users that have been active in the last XXX seconds on the home page, where XXX is the value specified by your Cookie Time-Out option (Default is last 15 minutes). Not recommended for sites with hundreds of simultaneous users. The Alphabetical option requires more resources than the random option.

If Daylight Savings Time is currently in effect for the above time zone, enable this option so that guests will see the correct times on posts and events. This has no effect on registered users as they control their DST options in the User CP.
Specify the time-limit (in minutes) within which the thread title may be edited by the user who started the thread.
Time Limit on Editing of Thread Title

Time limit (in minutes) to impose on editing of messages. After this time limit only moderators will be able edit or delete the message. 1 day is 1440 minutes.

Set the value to 0 to allow users to edit their posts indefinitely.
Time Limit on Editing of Posts

Specify in seconds how much time must elapse before a user may send consecutive emails.

Set to 0 to disable this flood check.
vBulletin includes a mail queuing system to prevent bottlenecks when sending lots of email. Use this option to specify how many emails will be sent per batch.
Number of Emails to Send Per Batch
Access masks are a simple way to manage forum permissions for individual users. If you don't use any access masks, turn this option off.
Banning allows you to stop certain IP addresses and email addresses from registering and posting to the forum.
You may have certain words censored on your forum. Words you choose to censor will be replaced by the character you specify below. All message titles and messages will be affected.

Enable the following email-sending features:
Report Bad Post
'Contact Us' Link
Email a Member
Email this Page to a Friend
New Post Notifications to Members

You can turn off the 'Send to Friend' feature for individual user groups in the User Permissions area.
Enable the member list? This allows users to view all users who belong to those usergroups that have "Viewable on Memberlist" enabled (See User Groups->Modify).
Turns the entire private messaging system on and off.

Allow searching for posts and threads within the forums. This is a relatively server-intensive process so you may want to disable it if you have problems.

To disable searching of all forums, delete the option from the searchintro template.
Enable the identification of search engine spiders.

If you would like to log all database errors to a file, enter the path to the file here. The file will be saved as {filename}.log.

Please note that the directory in which this file is to be created must be writable by the web server.

If you would like your vBulletin error logs to be rotated when they reach a certain size, enter the maximum file size in bytes here.
1048576 bytes = 1 megabyte.

When a log file reaches this size, it will be renamed as {filename}{unix timestamp}.log and a new file will be created.

Set this value to 0 to disable log rotation.
Maximum File Size of Error Logs

If you would like to log all failed Admin Control Panel login attempts to a file, enter the path to the file here. The file will be saved as {filename}.log

Please note that the directory in which this file is to be created must be writable by the web server.
Log Failed Admin Control Panel Logins to File
This setting allows you to enable/disable the Javascript content syndication system that allows you to embed vBulletin data in HTML pages.
This setting allows you to enable/disable the RSS content syndication system.
This setting allows you to enable/disable the XML content syndication system.

Fax number for your company. COPPA forms will be faxed to this number.

You may wish to check out http://www.efax.com/.

You may prevent your users from flooding your forum with posts by activating this feature.

By enabling floodcheck, you disallow users from making another post within a given time span of their last posting. In other words, if you set a floodcheck time span of 30 seconds, a user may not post again within 30 seconds of making his last post.

Administrators and moderators are exempt from floodcheck.

Recommended: 30 seconds. Type the number of seconds only. Enter 0 to disable this function.
This setting does the same job as the setting above, but this time for forumdisplay.php pages, rather than forum home.

This option allows you to set the script name of the page that acts as your forum home page. By default this will be 'index' (meaning index.php but you may want to call it 'forum' or whatever else you like for your own purposes.

If you change this value you must manually rename the forumhome PHP script to match the new value.
Script Name for Forum Home Page
Depth to show forums on forum home forum listings. If you set this value to '2', forum listings will show the current forum level and any child forums one level below (etc.)

Utilizes MySQL's internal indexing routines to perform message searching. Requires MySQL 4.0.1 or greater, thread and post set to MyISAM tables, and the the following indices

ALTER TABLE post ADD FULLTEXT INDEX (title,pagetext)
ALTER TABLE thread ADD FULLTEXT INDEX (title)
Version of GD installed on your server. You can find the version by searching for 'GD' on your phpinfo() output.

This option allows you to effectively add a user or users to every member's 'Ignore List'. However, users in this list can still see their own posts and threads...

Enter a list of userid numbers, separated by spaces (for example: 4 12 68 102).

If there are special words that are important for your forum but are outside the word length limits you specified above, you may enter them here so that they will be included in the search index.

For example, a web-programming forum with a minimum word length of 4 characters might want to include 'PHP' in the search index, even though the word is only 3 characters long.

Separate each word with a space.
Words to be Included Despite Character Limit

Set the level of GZIP compression that will take place on the output. 0=none; 9=max.

We strongly recommend that you use level 1 for optimum results.

Selecting yes will enable vBulletin to GZIP compress the HTML output of pages, thus reducing bandwidth requirements. This will be only used on clients that support it, and are HTTP 1.1 compliant. There will be a small performance overhead.

This feature requires the ZLIB library.

If you are already using mod_gzip on your server, do not enable this option.

Select 'Yes' here will hide private forums from users who are not allowed to access them. Users who do have permission to access them will have to log in before they can see these forums too.

This option applies to the any forum listing, including the Forum Jump menu, and Search Results.
Enabling this will show Admin names in Bold and Italics and Moderators' names in Bold on the logged in users and Who's Online.
Name of your homepage. This appears at the bottom of every page.
URL of your home page. This appears at the bottom of every page.
If 'Hot Threads' are enabled, threads with the specified number of posts or more will be shown as hot.
If 'Hot Threads' are enabled, threads with the specified number of views or more will be shown as hot.
Allow users to add Moderators and Administrators to their ignore list?

Setting this option to 'YES' will cause the system to not count words in [QUOTE] tags towards the total number of characters posted.

The primary use for this is to prevent users posting messages with enormous quotes and a single short word of their own.
Ignore Words in [QUOTE] Tags For Min Chars Check

Enter names in here that you do not want people to be able to register.

If any of the names here are included within the username, the user will told that there is an error. For example, if you make the name John illegal, the name Johnathan will also be disallowed.

Separate names by spaces.
Enter the meta keywords for all pages. These are used by search engines to index your pages with more relevance.
For every X points of reputation, users gain 1 point of reputation-altering power.
Select the default language for your forums. This language will be used for all guests, and any members who have not expressed a language preference in their options.

This value will chop the title of the last thread posted down to a specific number of characters for its display on a forum listing.

A value of 0 will not trim the titles at all.
Last Thread Title Maximum Displayed Characters

If you prefer the old-style postbit, using two vertical columns rather than the new horizontal layout, you can switch back to using that template with this switch.

Please note that if you enable this option and wish to customize the template, you should edit the 'postbit_legacy' template rather than the 'postbit'.
Link to individual pages of a thread spanning multiple pages on the forum listing?

vBulletin can read the overall load of the server on certain *NIX setups (including Linux).

This allows vBulletin to determine the load on the server and processor, and to turn away further users if the load becomes too high.

If you do not want to use this option, set it to 0.
A typical level would be 5.00 for a reasonable warning level.

Format of dates shown in Control Panel logs.

See: http://www.php.net/manual-lookup.php?function=date
For security reasons, you may wish to display the IP address of the person posting a message.

When a new post is submitted or a signature is edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
When linking to multiple pages in the forum display, this allows you to set the cut-off point on which long posts stop adding more page numbers and are replaced by 'more...'
Maximum length that a poll option can be.

Maximum number of options a user can select for the poll.

Set this option to 0 to allow any number of options.
The number of posts to display on a thread page in linear or hybrid mode before splitting it over multiple pages.
Maximum Displayed Posts Before Page Split
How many reputation clicks can a user give over each 24 hour period? Administrators are exempt from this limit.
Any search results over this number will be discarded.
Enter the maximum word length that the search engine is to index. The larger this number is, the larger your search index, and conversely your database is going to be.
The number of threads to display on a forum page before splitting it over multiple pages.
Maximum Displayed Threads Before Page Split
Enter the maximum number of characters in a valid username, for the purpose of ensuring that new members create valid usernames.
What user profile fields should be shown on the member list page?
The number of records per page that will be shown by default in the members list before the results are split over multiple pages.
You can define a mimimum post count that a user must reach before they are displayed on the memberlist.
How much reputation must a user have before his reputation hits count on others?
How many posts must a user have before his reputation hits count on others?
Enter the minimum word length that the search engine is to index. The smaller this number is, the larger your search index, and conversely your database is going to be.
Enter the minimum number of characters in a valid username, for the purpose of ensuring that new members create valid usernames.
Allows you to validate new members before they are classified as registered members and are allowed to post.
If the search query is for multiple words, this number will be added to the score for the item each time another word from the query is found.
Search Relevance Multi-Word Match Bonus Score
Please enter your NoChex email, all references to the subscription service will use this email.

Some email servers require the "-f" parameter to be sent with email calls from PHP. If you are having problems with users not receiving email, try enabling this option. In all likelihood, your problem will not be caused by this setting.
This email address will receive an email message when a new user signs up. Leave the option blank to disable this function.
Email Address to Notify About New Members
Selecting yes will cause vBulletin to add no-cache HTTP headers. These are very effective, so adding them may cause server load to increase due to an increase in page requests.
Time limit (in minutes) to allow user to edit the post without the [Edited by xxx] message appearing at the bottom of the edited post.
Time to Wait Before Starting to Display 'Edited by...'
How many avatars do you want to display per-page on the 'Edit Avatar' page within the profile editor?
How many columns of avatars do you wish to display to the user when selecting a pre-defined avatar?
Combine a forum's announcements into one listing, where the newest announcement is displayed?
If a thread/forum (etc.) requires multiple pages to be displayed, this option selects how many page links either side of the current page are shown. Set this to 0 to display all pages.
Number of Pages Visible in Page Navigator
For every X number of posts, users gain 1 point of reputation-altering power.

Private Message Flood Checking. Select the minimum time that must pass before a user can send another private message. This is to prevent a single user 'spamming' by sending lots of messages very quickly.

Set this to 0 to disable the option.

Maximum characters to allow in a private message.

Set this to 0 for no limit.
This setting allows you to limit the number of messages users may display per page on the private messages folder view pages.
This setting allows you to define the default number of messages displayed per-page on the private messages listings pages.
There is optional user information that you may display on each post. These options require a bit of processing time to calculate.

Posts that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their post.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

If this number is set to a value greater than 0, users must enter at least that number of characters in each new post.

Note: setting this to 0 will not completely disable the minimum characters per post check. Users must always enter at least 1 character.
Score for a word appearing in the post title.
Please enter your PayPal email, all references to the subscription service will use this email.
Enter the URL of your privacy statement, if you have one.
Allow users to include vB Code in their Private Messages? (Such as [b], [i] etc.)
Allow vB Code in Private Messages
Allow users to include [IMG] codes in their Private Messages?

Allow users to include raw HTML code in their Private Messages?
(Strongly not recommended.)
Allow the use of the standard message icons for private messages.
Allow Message Icons for Private Messages
Allow users to include smilies in their Private Messages?

Showing the last post on a member profile can cause large table scans which leads to table locking. This may increase load time on your forums as well as the load of your server. This option should only be enabled for smaller forums.
Show Last Post on Profile Page

Use this option to enable/disable the overall use of profile pictures.

Profile pictures are small images (although usually larger than avatars) that users can upload to their profile pages.
Maximum height in pixels that an user's profile picture may be.

The maximum file size (in bytes) that a user's profile picture may be.
1 KB = 1024 bytes
1 MB = 1048576 bytes
Maximum width in pixels that an user's profile picture may be.

Enable Quick Registration? If enabled, user's will only have to enter their Username, Password, Email address, and Any required custom profile fields. They may also choose their time zone if they wish.

If you enable Quick Reply, a box will appear on the showthread.php page allowing users to reply to the current thread without needing to load the full newreply.php page.

If Quick Reply is enabled, users still have the option to click on the reply button in order to use the full newreply.php page.

Enabling the WYSIWYG toolbar for Quick Reply can slow down the display of threads.

If you set this option to 'no', users will not have to click the Quick Reply icon in order to type a message in the quick reply box.

However, this will be at the expense of the usefulness of the Threaded and Hybrid view modes, as the system will not know to which post a user is replying, so the threaded view will become non-sensical.

Set this option to 'no' at your own discretion.

Setting this to 'Yes' will automatically fill the title field of new posts with either the thread or the parent post title, prefixed by 'Re: '.

The user may specify their own title if they want to do so.

Allows you to specify a function to operate on the average rating of a thread.
Works like: = func($thread[rating]) * $ratingscore
Amount to multiply the average rating of a thread to get the score for the thread.
For every X number of days, users gain 1 point of reputation-altering power.

If enabled, this option will display a random image to new users at registration time. The user will have to copy the contents of the image in order to verify that an automated system is not processing registrations. If you do not see an image below then your GD settings are wrong or not enabled. Check the GD option in "Server Settings and Optimization Options"

This is used to format dates shown with users' posts. In the left hand column of a thread display, under the username and title, there is some text showing when the user registered.

See: http://www.php.net/manual-lookup.php?function=date

Allows you to specify a function to operate on the number of replies of a thread.
Works like: = func($thread[replies]) * $replyscore
Amount to multiply the number of replies in a thread to get the score for the thread.
What reputation level shall new users receive upon registration? Make sure that you have a reputation level that is at least equal to or less than this value.
Turn the User Reputation system on and off.
How many different users must you give reputation to before you can hit the same person again? Administrators are exempt from this limit.

If you have any user gain a reputation that exceeds your lowest negative level, then this phrase will be used for them. If you do not wish to use this phrase, make sure you set a negative reputation that is larger than the largest score (negative) that a user on your forum has.

The default option is to require unique email addresses for each registered user. This means that no two users can have the same email address. You can disable this requirement by setting this option to 'No'.
If your server runs PHP with SAFE MODE Restrictions, set this to yes.

The minimum time (in seconds) that must expire before the user can perform a new search.

Set this to 0 to allow users to search as frequently as they want.
Number of successful search results to display per page.

If 'Allow Users to Email Other Members' is set to 'Yes', how should members' email addresses be displayed?

If this is set to 'Yes', then an online form must be filled in to send a user an email, thus hiding the destination email address.

Setting 'No' will mean that the user is just given the email address in order to send email using their email client application.

Set this to the maximum number of simultaneous sessions that you want to be active at any one time. If this number is exceeded, new users are turned away until the server is less busy.

Set this to 0 to disable this option.
Displays today's birthdays for those usergroups that have birthday display enabled (see User Groups->Usergroup Manager).
If you would like to use a default icon for messages without an icon, enter the path to the image here.

When this feature is enabled, a logged in user will see a 'dot' (or whatever graphic you choose) on the folder icons (hot folders, new folders, etc.) next to the threads that they have participated in.
Highlight Threads in Which User Has Posted

Choose the number of upcoming days that you wish to display upcoming events from.

Set to 0 to disable upcoming events.
Choose the method by which you wish to display the upcoming events if the "Display Calendar Events" option is enabled.
Show forum descriptions below forum titles in forum listings?
Show Forum Descriptions in Forum Listings

Enabling this option will show the current users browsing a particular forum on forumdisplay.php while adding one query. This can have an effect on performance. The Alphabetical option requires more resources than the random option.
Display upcoming holidays in the above events list?
